content:
=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Based on the rules, here’s an overview of what the game seems to be about and some ideas for playing it well.

• Game Genre and Feel
 – It’s a puzzle–action platformer with elements similar to classic adventure games (think Spelunky, with shifting boulders and collectible treasures). There are puzzle aspects (breaking dirt to open paths or create routes), hazardous obstacles (falling or moving boulders that can kill you if not handled correctly), and enemies with unpredictable behaviors. The mix of puzzle-solving and reacting in real time gives it a challenging, arcade-like feel.

• Core Mechanics
 – The world is built from different types of sprites:
  ○ Immovable blocks such as walls and dirt form the terrain.
  ○ A movable “avatar” (your character) has a built–in weapon (referred to as a “sword”) that may be used to interact with or break certain obstacles.
  ○ Collectibles like diamonds serve as resources that add to your score.
  ○ Falling or moving hazards like boulders and missiles can be dangerous if you collide badly (for example, boulders can kill you if you’re hit from below, or if you misjudge your jump from above).
  ○ Enemies (like the generic enemy, crabs, and butterflies) wander around, and they even interact among themselves (a crab can kill a butterfly or vice‐versa, sometimes transforming into a diamond and awarding points).

 – Interactions are defined by a set of rules that determine what happens when certain sprites meet. For instance:
  ○ Using the sword on dirt (or having dirt interact with the avatar’s sword) “kills” that sprite. This likely means you can clear dirt blocks to open up new paths.
  ○ Touching a diamond increases your score.
  ○ Jumping onto a boulder (or hitting it “from above”) will get rid of it, although it costs you points.
  ○ Some enemy interactions even yield extra resources—when a butterfly meets a crab, one transforms into a diamond and gives a bonus.

• Objective
 – The ultimate goal is to exit the level. The level contains an exit door, and when you trigger the exit door (by having your avatar interact with it under the right conditions), the game ends in a win.
 – Along the way, you want to collect diamonds to boost your score and possibly influence interactions, but you must be careful: There’s a rule attached to the exit door. It “kills” (or prevents exiting with) an avatar that has more than a certain amount of diamonds (the rule mentions a diamond limit of 9). This suggests you need to balance treasure collecting with the ability to safely leave—too many diamonds might block you from a proper exit.

• Win/Loss Conditions
 – You lose if your avatar is “killed” (that is, if your number of avatars drops to 0 by colliding with hazards, enemies, or making a wrong move).
 – You win if you manage to interact with the exit door correctly. (In this game, “killing” the exit door seems to be the trigger indicating you’ve left the level and won the game.)

• Overall Strategy Tips
 1. Controlled Resource Collection:
  • Collect diamonds to build up your score, but be cautious not to over‐collect if the exit door has a condition that can “kill” you when your diamond count is too high. Balance the desire for extra points with the need to leave safely.

 2. Use the Sword Wisely:
  • Your avatar comes equipped with a sword that can “kill” or remove certain blocks like dirt. This is likely your primary tool for clearing paths or even removing obstacles that might hinder your progress. Learn when to use it for breaking barriers versus saving it to avoid unnecessary penalties.

 3. Navigate Hazards:
  • Watch out for boulders and falling obstacles. If you’re going to hit a boulder from above (which may eliminate it), do so with caution since it will subtract points. It might be better sometimes just to avoid them.

 4. Manage Enemy Interactions:
  • Enemies like crabs and butterflies interact with one another. In some cases, letting these enemies collide might give you bonus diamonds. However, directly engaging enemies might cost you points or risk your avatar’s life. Use the environment and enemy reactions to your advantage—sometimes the best “attack” is to let the enemies fight amongst themselves.

 5. Plan Your Exit:
  • Your route should always include a plan for reaching the exit door while satisfying its conditions. Keep an eye on your inventory (especially the diamond count) and possibly adjust your gameplay (like avoiding extra pickups) as you approach the door.

In summary, the game challenges you to be precise in both action and resource management. You must break or avoid obstacles, carefully defeat or manipulate enemies, and collect just the right amount of treasures to score well while still being able to exit the level safely. A balanced strategy—prioritizing safe navigation, judicious use of your sword, and smart resource collection—is the key to mastering this game.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game. 

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
background dirt -> '.'
background -> '-'
background exitdoor -> 'e'
background boulder -> 'o'
background diamond -> 'x'
background crab -> 'c'
background butterfly -> 'b'
boulder -> '@'
butterfly -> '#'
crab -> '$'
diamond -> '%'
dirt -> '&'
exitdoor -> '*'
wall -> 'b'
sword -> 'd'

Action:5

I'm moving up from my current position (8,22) to (7,22) to avoid the enemy crab on my left and continue progressing toward the exit door while keeping a safe distance.
